page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY - HARMSTON
page.content: {ORIGINS:}Ermine Street _ ancient trackway settlement existed through Roman,Saxon & Danish periods. Named in 1086 "Hermodestune" in Soke of Waddington, Boothby Wapentake. By 1500 called{Harmston. {CONTROL: }In hands of Thorold family until C20. Church gift transferred to them after diss.of Mons.from St.Kath's Priory,Lincoln. With Church support Thorolds remained neutral during Civil War. Built fine Georgian mansion in landscaped parkland. {VILLAGE:}C18 Enclosures & Agric. Rev. brought release from poverty.Heathland reclaimed. Lowfields drained.Increased trading. 7 poor houses. Waddington Charity. Friendly societies. National School. Methodist & Quaker Chapels. Brass band. C20 Community hall. {NATIONAL FARMERS UNION}founded 1904. 5 farmers put Â£1 each in envelope.
